item.title: Report E-2025020410
item.description:
Report E-2025020410

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: HAZLETON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio Express
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, the drum was discovered to be leaking inside the trailer sitting on a skid. The drum was immediately turned up side down and placed into an overpack for containment. Investigation revealed that this drum was punctured by a protruding nail from the skid. The released material was neutralized and containerized for later disposal. The package specifications were not able to be safely obtained.

item.title: Report X-2025021295
item.description:
Report X-2025021295

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-04T15:15:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-15
  • City: BERWYN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was found to be leaking. There is a strong odor of gasoline. DG admin was called and it was discussed the inner contents looked to be brown and in class bottles and there was a very strong odor on gasoline. The package was then held. The customer has called and insist they need their "water" the DG agent let them know that we do not think this is water and that we are turing this over to the FAA for investigation. From our experience we truely believe this is a sample of some sort that contains a high level of gasoline because of the look and the smell of the spill this is not water. Also if it was water you could have shipped it in plastic contianers.

item.title: Report E-2025020401
item.description:
Report E-2025020401

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-28T00:58:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: MCKEES ROCKS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 275-gallon poly IBC tote due to a forklift accident that resulted in the tote being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020357
item.description:
Report E-2025020357

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 25,2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean the trailer interior. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon and one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020279
item.description:
Report E-2025020279

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a drum that had slid off of a pallet during transit and as a result a slat from the wooden pallet it was staged on slightly punctured the bottom of the drum consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and clean with absorbent and placed into a recovery container. The drum was repaired with drum putty and placed into a recovery container as well.

item.title: Report E-2025020276
item.description:
Report E-2025020276

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: West Chester
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When unloading freight material handler discovered a pail in the center of a pallet that had been struck by a forklift forkblade when loaded by shipper consequently puncturing the pail contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the damaged pail.
